org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.aneka

Class AnekaProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.Provider<T,S>
      • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.AndroidProvider<T,S>
        • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.AsyncProvider<T,S>
          • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.core.ThreadPoolProvider<T,S>
            • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.aneka.AnekaProvider<T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the input data
    S - type of the output data
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnekaProviderTest.SimpleAnekaProvider, SimpleAnekaProvider

    public abstract class AnekaProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
extends ThreadPoolProvider<T,S>
    Simple provider for Aneka. For sake of simplicity, only one input file and one output file are used. When attached to the ExecutionManager, authentication and application creation will be performed. When started, these are the actions that this class will do:
    1. Serialize input data;
    2. Send serialized data as a file to the FTP server;
    3. Start execution of the defined task;
    4. Retrieve output file from the FTP server;
    5. De-serialize the output file to produce the output data.
    When extending this class, these methods must be overridden:
    • initCredentials() to initialize the parameters to be used in authentication and application creation, namely: url, username, password appName.
    • initStorageBuckets() to specify the StorageBuckets that will be used. In the most simple case, only one StorageBucket would be necessary and it will automatically be used for both the input and the output files.
    • initSharedFiles() to specify the shared files used by the application.
    • buildTasks() to specify which tasks to execute with the data.
    • getInputVirtualPath()} to specify the virtual path in which to place the input file.
    • getOutputVirtualPath()} to specify the virtual path in which to place the output file.
    • inputToBytes(Data[]) and inputToString(Data[]) to specify how data should be serialized (only one of the two is usually needed, the other can be left empty).
    • bytesToOutput(byte[]) and stringToOutput(String) to specify how data should be de-serialized (only one of the two is usually needed, the other can be left empty).
    The file type used in FTP transfers can be set through the constructor. Depending on whether ASCII mode is used or not, different functions for serialization and de-serialization will be used. In order to support more advanced use-cases, these methods may be overridden:
    • onLogin(AnekaWebServices, boolean) to perform action immediately after login is completed.
    • getFTPOutputBucket() and getFTPInputBucket() to specify which bucket to use for download/upload to the FTP server. By default the first bucket will be used for both.
    • getOutputBucket() and getInputBucket() to specify which bucket the Aneka server will use to use for upload/download from the FTP server. By default the first bucket will be used for both.
    • buildInputPath(String) and buildOutputPath(String) to specify the paths of input and output files in the FTP server. By default a random UUID is generated for each task and used as base directory in which the same directory structure as in the virtual execution environment will be recreated ("/$UUID/$virtualPath").
    • buildJob(String, Data[]) to specify a different way to build the Job with regards to what has been described above.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnekaProvider

        public AnekaProvider(int fileType,
                     int nThreads,
                     java.lang.Class<T> inputType,
                     java.lang.Class<S> outputType)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        fileType - the file type to be used in FTP transfers: FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE or FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE). In most cases FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE is the most appropriate.
        nThreads - the number of threads this provider can run on.
        inputType - the type of the input data.
        outputType - the type of the output data.

      • getData

        public S[] getData(AsyncProvider.ProgressPublisher progressPublisher,
                   long requestID,
                   T... input)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AsyncProvider
        Provides the data given some input data. It will be called in AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.doInBackground(Data[])
        Specified by:
        getData in class AsyncProvider<T extends Data,S extends Data>
        Parameters:
        progressPublisher - interface for publishing progress through Provider.publishProgress(long, int, String) by using AsyncTask.publishProgress(Object[]) and AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.onProgressUpdate(ProgressData[]).
        requestID - the id of the request that is being serviced.
        input - the input data.
        Returns:
        the output data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any exception thrown will be caught in and passed to AsyncProvider.onPostExecuteError(long, Throwable).
        See Also:
        AsyncProvider.ProviderAsyncTask.doInBackground(Data[]), AsyncProvider.execute(long, Data[])

      • initCredentials

        protected abstract void initCredentials()
        Sets the values of url, username, password, appName. This method will be called when attached to the ExecutionManager in order to provide a way to change the credentials in response to a UI event. After the new credentials are set, a login will be started.
